definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Raise the Red Lantern (1991), movie by Zhang Yimou 張藝謀|张艺谋[Zhang1 Yi4 mou2]
pinyin: Da4 hong2 Deng1 long2 Gao1 gao1 Gua4

definition: an expensive type of oolong tea
(bird species of China) greater flamingo (Phoenicopterus roseus)
rhinophyma (red nose, often related to rosacea or excessive alcohol)/brandy nose

sentences.english: Chinese lanterns hang from the ceilings of the main entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 在正門入口處，大紅的中國燈籠高高懸掛着。

sentences.english: Blessed eggs Eggs that are dyed red can be gifts for others.
sentences.chinese: 喜蛋》雞蛋塗上了大紅色，當地人送人的禮物。

sentences.english: Where the Spice Girls really, really came into their own was in marketing and merchandising.
sentences.chinese: 辣妹們真正大紅大紫是在市場銷售上。

sentences.english: Big Red: What are you doing?
sentences.chinese: 我想借你的大紅冠用一天，好嗎？

sentences.english: The big guy in the bright red mohawk was right.
sentences.chinese: 留大紅莫西幹頭的球迷是對的，火箭在劫難逃。

sentences.english: The bleakness is with strong red and green background, dispersing after a grand feast.
sentences.chinese: 這是一片大紅大綠襯托出的蒼涼，盛宴後的散席。

sentences.english: Question:why most local cartoon can't be popular ?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼本土動漫不能大紅大紫？

sentences.english: Scarlet were the clothes she wore.

sentences.chinese: 大多數的猩猩木石大紅色。

sentences.english: Several years later, she gets very popular as expected.
sentences.chinese: 若干年後果然大紅大紫。

sentences.english: The Dahongshan deposit is a famous, large and rich copper-iron deposit in Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 雲南大紅山鐵礦是一個著名的大型富銅鐵礦牀。

sentences.english: In other words, my toenails weren't turning all purple and falling off because of this.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，我的腳指頭沒有因此變得“大紅大紫”。

sentences.english: I was afraid of that pawnshop's big red door, afraid of its high counter.
sentences.chinese: 我怕當鋪的那個大紅門，那個大高長櫃檯。

sentences.english: Paying little heed, they put on him a pair of soft red shoes, which, however, were coarsely made.
sentences.chinese: 兩足纏過，衆宮娥草草做了一雙軟底大紅鞋替他穿上。

sentences.english: As the white-haired boy, she got her promotion as expected soon.
sentences.chinese: 作爲大紅人，如預期一樣，她很快就升職了。

sentences.english: Large red worms, which were crawling on the ground, furnished bait.
sentences.chinese: 把在地面上爬動的大紅毛蟲當做釣餌。

definition: ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
